projectPurpose: To provide a hands-on, exercise-based workshop for learning how to write Rust procedural macros.
mainFeatures: Structured exercises for learning procedural macros
Covers different types of procedural macros (derive, attribute, function-like)
Practical application of `syn` and `quote` crates
Suitable for self-paced learning or guided workshops

alternatives.name: The Rust Programming Language Book (Macros chapter)
mainFeatures: Official comprehensive guide to Rust
Covers declarative and procedural macros basics
Explains derive, attribute, and function-like macros
Introduction to `proc_macro`, `syn`, `quote`

alternatives.name: The Rust Reference (Procedural Macros section)
mainFeatures: Official technical reference
Detailed explanation of procedural macro types
Covers TokenStream input/output
Information on error handling in macros

alternatives.name: The Little Book of Rust Macros
mainFeatures: Detailed guide on Rust macros
Covers both declarative and procedural macros
Explains underlying concepts
Aims to be a primary learning resource

alternatives.name: Various online tutorials and guides (Blogs)
mainFeatures: Step-by-step explanations
Practical code examples
Cover setup and dependencies (`syn`, `quote`)
Address specific macro use cases

alternatives.name: Video Tutorials (e.g., YouTube)
mainFeatures: Visual explanation of concepts
Walkthroughs of coding examples
Often cover setup and debugging tips
Diverse range of topics and depth

alternatives.name: syn and quote crate documentation
mainFeatures: API reference for parsing Rust code (`syn`)
API reference for generating Rust code (`quote`)
Essential libraries for writing procedural macros
Include usage examples for core functionalities

mostWellKnownAlternative: The Rust Programming Language Book (Official Documentation)
marketPositioning: proc-macro-workshop is positioned as a practical, hands-on learning resource for Rust procedural macros, complementing more theoretical documentation like the official book and reference. Its exercise-based structure makes it ideal for developers who learn best by doing and want to gain practical experience in writing macros, particularly for use in workshops or focused self-study.
